meanings.definition: To look at or watch closely or with interest.
meanings.sent1: The cat was eying the bird on the branch.
meanings.sent2: She was eying the beautiful painting in the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The detective was eying the suspect's every move.
meanings.sent4: The photographer was eying the perfect shot through the lens.
meanings.sent5: The child was eying the colorful candies in the store window.

meanings.sent1: He was eying the idea of starting his own business.
meanings.sent2: She was eying the decision carefully before making a choice.
meanings.sent3: The student was eying the difficult math problem with confusion.
meanings.sent4: The author was eying the blank page, searching for inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The team was eying the championship trophy, dreaming of victory.
